text: 'The Phi Tau Phi Scholastic Honor Society of the Republic of China (or simply Phi Tau Phi or '; ) was founded by American professor Joseph H. Ehlers in 1921 in Peiyang University, China. This Society aims to encourage scholarship, stimulate research, reward scholastic achievement, and form bonds of intellectual and professional fellowship. Phi Tau Phi stands for Philosophia, Technologia, and Physiologia, which collectively represent all disciplines of learning. ==External links == * Phi Tau Phi.org Category:Honor societies Category:Student organizations established in 1921 Category:1921 establishments in China
title: Phi Tau Phi
